Class BankAccount

java.lang.Object
  BankAccount

public class BankAccount
extends java.lang.Object

BankAccount class models a simple bank account - Each account has a unique account number, as well as a customer name and current balance - This bank does not allow for an overdraft COMP 1451 lab 3

Version:
October 2007 modified January 2008, July 2008
Author:
Colleen Penrowley

Field Summary
static int FIRST_ACCOUNT_NUMBER
          starting point for account numbers -- currently set to 100
static double INTEREST_RATE
          percentage to be added to balance each time applied -- currently set to one percent
 
Constructor Summary
BankAccount(java.lang.String customerName)
          Constructor for objects of class BankAccount - This constructor sets the balance to zero by default.
BankAccount(java.lang.String customerName, double initialBalance)
          Constructor for objects of class BankAccount - This constructor sets the balance to zero if the amount passed in is not a positive value.
 
Method Summary
 void applyInterest()
          Adds interest to the account balance, based on current interest rate - Each time the method is invoked, the percentage is calculated and added to the account balance.
 void deposit(double amountToDeposit)
          Deposits the specified amount to the account - If the value passed in is not a positive amount, the balance will not change.
 int getAccountNumber()
          Returns the unique identifier for this account
 double getBalance()
          Returns the balance in the account
 java.lang.String getCustomerName()
          Returns the customer name
static void resetAccountCounter()
          STATIC method to reset the account counter for the purpose of testing.
 java.lang.String toString()
          Provides account info as a returned String.
 void withdraw(double amountToWithdraw)
          Withdraws the specified amount from the account - Tests the parameter for validity - Account balance cannot be negative.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

Method Detail

applyInterest

public void applyInterest()
Adds interest to the account balance, based on current interest rate - Each time the method is invoked, the percentage is calculated and added to the account balance.

deposit

public void deposit(double amountToDeposit)
Deposits the specified amount to the account - If the value passed in is not a positive amount, the balance will not change.

Parameters:
double - amount to be deposited to the account

getAccountNumber

public int getAccountNumber()
Returns the unique identifier for this account

Returns:
int unique identifier for this account

getBalance

public double getBalance()
Returns the balance in the account

Returns:
double current balance in the account

getCustomerName

public java.lang.String getCustomerName()
Returns the customer name

Returns:
String customer name of this account

resetAccountCounter

public static void resetAccountCounter()
STATIC method to reset the account counter for the purpose of testing. This method should be invoked at the beginning of the setup method in the test class.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Provides account info as a returned String.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
account details: customer name, account number, current balance

withdraw

public void withdraw(double amountToWithdraw)
Withdraws the specified amount from the account - Tests the parameter for validity - Account balance cannot be negative.

Parameters:
double - amount to withdraw from the account
